result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin J. Musgrove

defendant.name: Musgrove, Martin J.
defendant.address: W7250 Blackhawk Island Rd, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 16CM114 & 15CM401 called together at 1:24 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Martin J. Musgrove in court with Attorney John Robert Dade. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court notes for the parties that case 15CM401 is only set for review as that case was read-in for sentencing purposes
DA Happ submits victim impact statement; Sentencing arguments by DA Happ; Statements by Anita Johnstonbaugh; Sentencing arguments by Atty Dade

The Court IMPOSES AND STAYS 9 MONTHS JAIL WITHOUT HUBER, CONSECUTIVE, AND PLACES THE DEFENDANT ON PROBATION FOR 1 YEAR WITH CONDITIONS:
--noT violate the terms of the injuncion that is in place
--comply with any family court orders relating to contact with his ex-wife and their children
--not have contact with his ex-wife except as authorized by the family court orders and/or the injunctions
--submit to any type of assessment, counseling, or therapy required by the Agent
--to take any prescribed medications as prescribed
--not make any threats to any persons or engage in any acts of violence
--pay all mandory costs, fees and surcharges by statute, including DNA Surcharge
--to submit DNA Sample upon demand
--to pay $33 subpoena fees

Atty Dade requests that Mr. Musgrove be able to report to probation tomorrow due to scheduled doctor appt. today at 3:00 pm
Court orders Mr. Musgrove to report to the probation office by noon tomorrow
0 days credit for time served
Recess: 2:01 pm

Cases 15CM401 and 16CM114 called together at 2:56pm
Defendant Martin J. Musgrove in court with Attorney John Robert Dade.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 16CM114
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.

As to Both Cases: 
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest  " entered on Case 16CM114; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Case 15CM401
On Motion of the State, the Court considers an uncharged read in

As to Case 16CM114:
The Court requires a $500 signature bond, with the conditions:
--no contact with Anita Johnstonbaugh
--abide by all conditions in case 15CV217
--booking at JESO today

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling

recess: 3:05pm

NEXT: Sentencing Hearing on 3/24/16 at 1:15pm
States motion to allow admission of other crimes, wrongs, or acts of evidence

Case called at 9:59 am [Clerk SH] (Final Status Scheduling Conference)
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Martin J. Musgrove in court with Attorney John Robert Dade. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews off-record discussion in which Counsel requested motion hearing prior to trial as motions will effect witnesses
Clerk announces date for the record; Atty Dade requests the Court address State's motion in limine today as have no objection
Atty Dade for the record expresses his objection to hearing the State's motion on other acts on Thursday, presents basis

Court grants motion upon no objection from defense
Atty Dade informs the Court that he objects to some paragraphs within motion in limine, as would like them to be recipricol
Court withdraws granting of motion upon comments of Atty Dade and informs parties to have Judge Koschnick address motion on Thursday
Court informs parties that since matter is being heard on Thursday and may have some effect on witnesses, they can address those matters with the Court on Thursday and the Court
can also address other final status matters on Thursday following motion hearing as well. 
Recess: 10:05 am

NEXT: (1) Motion hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 02:45 pm. - Notices given in Court
States motion to amend criminal complaint
States motion to impeach the defendant with prior convictions/adjudications
States notice of intent to admit statements made by the defendant

Case called at 2:03 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Martin J. Musgrove in court with Attorney John Robert Dade. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Dade files Motions in Limine and Demand for Discovery
Counsel confirm they are ready to proceed to trial as scheduled; settlement discussions have not concluded, but not likely it will settle
Counsel agree that one day is still sufficient for scheduling
State: 4 witnesses
Defense: Anticipating 1 - 2 witnesses, depending on testimony of one of the State's witnesses
Court discusses adding a day to trial - March 1st - Counsel agree
Court informs parties to subpoena witnesses for both dates
Court reminds Mr. Musgrove that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 2:11 pm

NEXT: (1) Case to remain as scheduled AND add March 1st as jury trial date- Send notices

Case called at 9:01 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Martin J. Musgrove in court with Attorney John Robert Dade. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial DEMANDED by the Defendant
off-record: 9:06 - 9:09 am for scheduling

Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with Anita Johnstonbaugh except for contact in court for court purposes and as allowed by family court orders
-Comply with all existing court orders
-Booking at JCSD
Recess: 9:12 am 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 1/27/16 at 2:20 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 2/9/16 at 2:00 pm - Send notices (3) Schedule FSSC 2/23/16 at 9:00 am - Send notices (4) Schedule JT 2/29/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices
to reschedule a hearing at an earlier date

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
